description.other_contributors: Koray Atalag, University of Auckland, New Zealand

details.purpose: To record the TNM staging classification for lung cancer (Sixth Edition).
details.use: Use only for the Sixth edition of TNM lung cancer classification.
details.misuse: Not to be used for pleural mesothelioma, sarcoma or other rare lung tumours. Not to be used for other editions of TNM classification.

description.other_details:
Greene FL, Page DL, Fleming ID. et al, eds, for the American Joint Committee on Cancer. AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 6th ed. New York, NY: Springer-Verlag; 2002.
American Joint Committee on Cancer. TNM schema files [Internet]. [cited 2009 Jul 27 ] Available from: http://www.cancerstaging.org/education/tnmschema/tnmschema.html

items.items: Tumour ≤3cm in greatest dimension and completely surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and not involving a main bronchus.

Tumour >3cm in greatest dimension;or, Involves main bronchus, 2cm or more distal to the carina;or, Invades the visceral pleura; or, Associated with atelectasis of obstructive pneumonia that extends to the hilar region but does not involve entire lung.

Tumour of any size that directly invades chest wall, diaphragm, mediastinal pleura, parietal pericardium; or, Tumour in main bronchus <2cm from carina; or, Tumour with associated atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis involving the entire lung.
Tumour of any size that invades mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, oesophagus, vertebral body, carina; or, Separate tumour nodules in same lobe; or,Tumour with malignant pleural effusion.
No metastasis to regional lymph nodes.
Metastasis to ipsilateral intralobar, peribronchial and/or hilar nodes including nodes involved by direct extension of the primary tumour.
Metastasis to ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal nodes.
Metastasis to contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular nodes.
T2 N1 M0 ; T3 N0 M0
T1 N2 M0, T2 N2 M0, T3 N1 M0, T3 N2 M0
Any T N3 M0, T4 Any N M0
Tumour ≤3cm in greatest dimension and completely surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and not involving a main bronchus.

Tumour >3cm in greatest dimension; or, Involves main bronchus, 2cm or more distal to the carina; or, Invades the visceral pleura; or, Associated with atelectasis of obstructive pneumonia that extends to the hilar region but does not involve entire lung.

Tumour of any size that directly invades chest wall, diaphragm, mediastinal pleura, parietal pericardium; or, Tumour in main bronchus <2cm from carina; or, Tumour with associated atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis involving the entire lung.
Tumour of any size that invades mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, oesophagus, vertebral body, carina; or, Separate tumour nodules in same lobe; or, Tumour with malignant pleural effusion.
No metastasis to regional lymph nodes.
Metastasis to ipsilateral intralobar, peribronchial and/or hilar nodes including nodes involved by direct extension of the primary tumour.
Metastasis to ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal nodes.
Metastasis to contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular nodes.
A framework for the classification and grading of malignancies. Primarily based on the TNM classification. Normally specialised for individual tumours.
TNM Staging classification for lung cancer (Sixth edition) .
Clinical TNM pre-treatment classification based on physical examination, imaging and biopsies.
Clincal assessment of the primary tumour.
Clinical assessment of the regional lymph nodes.
Pathological staging. Based on the clinical staging, results of prrocedures and pathological histo-pathological assessment.
Pathological assessment of the primary tumour.
Pathological assessment of the regional lymph nodes.
The overall Clinical staging derived from each T, N and M component e.g T1aM0NX. May include additional TNM descriptors.
The overall Pathological staging derived from each pT, pN and pM component. May include additional TNM descriptors.
A text comment on the Clinical staging.
A text comment on the Pathological staging.
Clinical assessment of post-treatment residual tumour.
Presence of residual tumour cannot be assessed.
Pathological assessment of post-treatment residual tumour.
Presence of residual tumour cannot be assessed.
Grade of differentiation cannot be assessed.
